structure.unit: Sec. 12-2092. - SURRENDER, DISPLAY, LOSS, ETC., OF DRIVER'S PERMIT.

law.catch_line: SURRENDER, DISPLAY, LOSS, ETC., OF DRIVER'S PERMIT.

text.section: A driver's permit which has been revoked shall be immediately thereafter surrendered to the taxicab inspector.

In any case in which the holder of a driver's permit has lost, destroyed or mutilated his permit, he shall immediately report such facts to the taxicab inspector who shall issue a duplicate driver's permit to the permittee. A charge of one dollar ($1.00) shall be collected by the taxicab inspector for each duplicate permit issued. Beginning on January 1, 2011,, the cost of replacement of lost permit will increase to ten dollars ($10.00), and then on January 1, 2012, the amount will cap at twenty dollars ($20.00).
